lenders.name: Etherealmind
lenders.loan_because:
I want to put something back. When travellng in Africa a charity worker explained how to "Feed a man a fish and you've fed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you have fed him for life". 

This is my attempt to help people make their lives better everyday.
lenders.occupational_info: I run a website etherealmind.com, and a share of the revenue is donated to this site. I remain opposed to Kiva offering lending in the first world.

lenders.name: Edi
lenders.loan_because: Until now, no credit scheme that has touched the laborer. Banks and private-party governments are more likely to give farmers capital assistance to entrepreneurs.
lenders.occupational_info:
I am a graduate of high school in Jakarta, in 1996. When I finished school I was accepted to work in a foreign supermarket companies with a BILO. In 1998 I was hit by layoffs, the company hit by financial crisis. To maintain my life trying to become a pedicab driver, motorcycle taxi bike, bajaj driver and courier mail.
In 2000 my mother died. Finally, I returned to my hometown to be with the father who lives alone. This kampong I began to learn traditional way of farming. Until the end I tried to become farm laborers and earn Rp 7.500,-  a day. Here a lot of villages see the untapped potential, such as the utilization of agricultural production to increase income communities.
Youth in my community are more likely to seek revenue to the city by becoming a worker in a factory. So many of the abandoned agricultural land or rented to farm laborers with deposit systems. But this system is very harmful because the cost of agricultural production is currently very expensive. The most dominant is the price of fertilizer. Based on this I initiated a program but a cheap farm income doubled. This program included chicken livestock, poultry fish and vegetables. The program is inter-related, such as chicken manure fertilizer can be used as vegetables. While the vegetables are not worthy of sale could be used as fish feed ingredients. To realize the program I tried talking to some community. But all have the same constraints, ie capital. Funds collected from the farmworker is very far from expectations. Finally, I consult with the bank. The result is the bank asked me with a variety of requirements such as security, income certificate, and others. The question is whether that can be used as collateral to the bank for a low-income farm workers and have no land?. This is what prompted me to write a request for a loan to Kiva. This information can be from a student at the Institute Technology of Bandung. And to write this I am trying mentranslate language through google translate. So if there are errors in the writing of thank you beg forgiveness.

lenders.name: Sonia
lenders.occupation: Teacher/ Currently stay at home mum
lenders.loan_because: As a mother and a teacher, I have come to realise that the greatest gift you can give someone is the sense of self-empowerment. I believe in helping others to help themsleves and in turn, help those around them. In self empowerment, we can find confidence, happiness, drive and ambition to do better and be better. Something as small as lending someone $25 can change their world and the world of those around them. It's a win-win situation.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a full-time stay at home who absolutely loves and is grateful for being able to spend time with my girls.

lenders.occupational_info: I make websites.

I wanted to enable others to put that money to good use and do something positive and productive with it instead.
lenders.occupational_info: I am basically a lawyer, but in the area of intellectual property only.  Patent attorneys are not typical lawyers as they come from science backgrounds, for example I did Chemistry at university.  I spend my time advising clients on protections they can get for their inventions, obtaining the protection for them, and helping the inventor enforce that protection.

This has a REAL effect concerning REAL people with REAL stories. I love it!
lenders.occupational_info: I teach students to prepare for the entrance exams for medical school, dental school, and optometry school. I also work to help foreign doctors prepare for their US licensure exams in the hopes of securing a residency here.

lenders.occupational_info: I am a Flight Purser (Lead Flight Attendant). I manage inflight service on transoceanic passenger jets. I work to maintain excellent customer service to passengers and to act as a liason between the cabin crew and the pilots. I just love smiling at the passengers as they board the plane, caring for them as we fly and learning more about them and their reasons for travel.

Hopefully, I can give someone a chance to show the world what my mom wanted to do - i.e. make a decent living and do what they love....
lenders.occupational_info: I analyze and evaulate the market value of commerical real estate for large clients in order to help them on their investment decisons.

lenders.loan_because: Everyone deserves support when they are passionate about achieving something and improving their life and the lives of those around them. I would want the same for my family, my friends and myself.

lenders.name: Rachel

lenders.occupational_info: I teach a class of 34 7-8 year olds in a Christian school in a market town in Wiltshire, England. Every day is so different and so much fun, it's what gets me out of bed each day!

lenders.name: Grace
lenders.loan_because: My dad set this up for me. I have money in the bank that I can't use until I grow up, so he thought this would be a good idea. He's going to save all the emails about people I help, so I can read them some day.
lenders.occupational_info: My most important work is helping people smile and remember that they have a God-spot inside no matter what.
